frame.name: Similarity
frame.definition:
<def-root>Two or more distinct entities, which may be concrete or abstract objects or types, are characterized as being similar to each other. Depending on figure/ground relations, the entities may be expressed in two distinct frame elements and constituents , <fen>Entity_1</fen> and <fen>Entity_2</fen>, or jointly as a single frame element and constituent, <fen>Entities</fen>. The similarity may be based on appearance, physical properties, or other characteristics of the two entities. However, no such <fen>Dimension</fen> has to be specified explicitly. The <fen>Entities</fen> may be like each other to a greater or lesser <fen>Degree</fen>. Rather than specifying the <fen>Dimension</fen> of difference, a <fen>Differentiating_fact</fen> may be mentioned. <ex></ex> Notice that, although similarity presupposes the notion of a judge who assesses similarity, that judge is not part of the frame of similarity.
<ex><fex name="Entity_1">A mulberry</fex> <m>is</m> <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>similar</t> <fex name="Dimension">in shape</fex> <fex name="Entity_2">to a loganberry</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Entity_1">Recovering it afterwards</fex> can also <m>be</m> <t>similar</t> <fex name="Entity_2">to collecting an unsecured loan</fex> </ex> <ex><fex name="Entities">Great Britain and Germany</fex> <m>were</m> only <t>alike</t> <fex name="Dimension">in one respect</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Entity_1">Lothlorien</fex> <m>is</m> <fex name="Degree">quite</fex> <t>like</t> <fex name="Entity_2">most of their other war games</fex> really.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entities
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose similarity is at issue.
<ex> <fex name="Entities">The two painters</fex> <m>were</m> <t>alike</t> in being unable to draw acceptably . </ex> <ex>Agbenugba confirms the <t>resemblances</t> <fex name="Entities">between his own experience and that of his protagonist</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity_1
FE.definition:
<def-root>When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the entity characterized by its similarity to <fen>Entity_2</fen>, whose characteristics are assumed to be known. <fen>Entity_1</fen> is often an external argument.
<ex>In the first phase <fex name="Entity_1">Barthes's approach</fex> <m>has</m> <t>similarities</t> to that of Levi-Strauss.</ex> <ex><fex name="Entity_1">Our economy</fex> <m>is</m> <t>like</t> a healthy plant after a long drought</ex> <ex>I found a <t>similar</t> <fex name="ent1">passage</fex> in Tolkien.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity_2
FE.definition:
<def-root>When the <fen>Entities</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Entity_2</fen> is the one whose characteristics are assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing characteristics of <fen>Entity_1</fen>.
<ex>The results of Method 2 <m>show </m>remarkable <t>similarity</t> <fex name="Entity_2">to those obtained by Method 1</fex></ex> <ex>Leadbelly's recordings are not <t>dissimilar</t> <fex name="Entity_2">to those of Jimmie Rodgers</fex>.</ex> <ex>This is a problem <t>different</t> <fex name="ent2">from meltdown</fex> only in degree.</ex> <ex>Here we see a <t>similar</t> case. <fex name="ent2">DNI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Dimension
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the entities is assessed.
<ex>The disc announced Friday is <fex name="Dimension">physically</fex> <t>similar</t> to current music CDs </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which entities are similar to each other, in general or with respect to some <fen>Dimension</fen>(s)
<ex>The twins are <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>similar</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the similarity occurs or exists.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The Place is the general area in which similarity occurs or exists</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the Manner in which Dimension is similar or different</def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root>An inanimate entity or process that causes the similarity.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the state of the <fen>Entities</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.</def-root>

FE.name: Differentiating_fact
FE.definition:
<def-root>A fact about <fen>Entity_1</fen> or the <fen>Entities</fen> that reveals how <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the same or different from other entities. (Note the contrast with 'as to'.)
<ex>His presidency was <t>different</t> <fex name="Differentiating_fact">in that it offered a way forward for the common man</fex> .</ex> <ex>Banks primarily <t>differ</t> <fex name="Differentiating_fact">in offering different rates for different risks</fex> .</ex> <ex>We are all <t>similar</t> <fex name="Differentiating_fact">in having two arms , two legs , a mind , and a heart to feel with</fex> .</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: similar.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of the same kind in appearance, character, or quantity, without being identical

lexUnit.name: dissimilar.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not similar; different.

lexUnit.name: similarity_((mass)).n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being similar to something else

lexUnit.name: dissimilarity.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being not similar or different from something

lexUnit.name: alike.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: similar.

lexUnit.name: resemble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have a similar appearance to or features in common with

lexUnit.name: different.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not the same as another or each other; unlike in nature, form, or quality

lexUnit.name: unlike.prep
lexUnit.definition: COD: in contrast to

lexUnit.name: resemblance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state of resembling.

lexUnit.name: unlike.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: different, dissimilar

lexUnit.name: ringer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: somebody who strongly resembles another person

lexUnit.name: spitting image.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the exact double of

lexUnit.name: like.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person or thing that is similar to a familiar one

lexUnit.name: similarity_((count)).n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a point of commonality or likeness.

lexUnit.name: like.prep
lexUnit.definition: COD: in the manner of

lexUnit.name: like.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having similar characteristics to another

lexUnit.name: differ.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be unlike or dissimilar.

lexUnit.name: distinct.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: recognizably different in nature; individual or separate.

lexUnit.name: difference_((count)).n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a way in which people or things are different.

lexUnit.name: parallel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a similarity or comparison

lexUnit.name: difference.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state or condition of being different.

lexUnit.name: vary.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: differ in size, degree, or nature from something else of the same general class.

lexUnit.name: discrepancy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an illogical or surprising lack of compatibility or similarity between two or more fact

lexUnit.name: discrepant.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: exhibiting an illogical or surprising lack of compatibility or similarity between two or more facts.

lexUnit.name: disparity.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a great difference

lexUnit.name: disparate.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: essentially different in kind; not able to be compared.

lexUnit.name: distinction.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a marked difference or contrast.

lexUnit.name: variant.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a form or version that varies from other forms of the same thing or from a standard.

lexUnit.name: dissimilarity_((mass)).n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the fact that (entities) are dissimilar.

lexUnit.name: image.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the exact likeness (of someone)

lexUnit.name: very image.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the exact likeness of

lexUnit.name: take after.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to look like or resemble
